recipe_ingredients: 1 lb Halal minced beef, 1 tbsp coconut oil, 1 onion, chopped, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 inch ginger, grated, 1 red bell pepper, chopped, 1 green bell pepper, chopped, 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes, 1 can (13.5 oz) coconut milk, 2 tbsp curry powder, 1 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp cumin, 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper (optional), Salt and pepper to taste, 1 cup chopped cilantro, for garnish, Cooked rice, for serving
recipe_instruction:
Heat coconut oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the minced beef and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon. Remove the beef from the pot and set aside.
Add the onion to the pot and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute more.
Add the bell peppers and cook until slightly softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the diced tomatoes, coconut milk, curry powder, turmeric, cumin, and cayenne pepper (if using). Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Return the beef to the pot and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot over rice, garnished with cilantro.
